dict.string: #!/usr/bin/env ruby # TODO - not yet implemented $tags = [ { :label => "TODO", :color => "#CF830D", :regexp => /TODO[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/i }, { :label => "CALL", :color => "#CF830D", :regexp => /CALL[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/i }, { :label => "EMAIL", :color => "#CF830D", :regexp => /EMAIL[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/i }, { :label => "CALL", :color => "#CF830D", :regexp => /CALL[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/i }, { :label => "WAIT", :color => "#CF830D", :regexp => /WAIT[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/i }, { :label => "DONE", :color => "#008000", :regexp => /DONE[\s,:]+(\w.*)$/ }, ] require "#{ENV['TM_SUPPORT_PATH']}/lib/textmate" require "erb" include ERB::Util def TextMate.file_link (file, line = 0) return "txmt://open/?url=file://" + file.gsub(/[^a-zA-Z0-9.-\/]/) { |m| sprintf("%%%02X", m[0]) } + "&line=" + line.to_s end # setup empty array for per tag results $tags.each { |tag| tag[:matches] = [ ] } TextMate.each_text_file do |file| $tags.each do |tag| File.open(file) do |io| io.grep(tag[:regexp]) do |content| results = { :file => file, :line => io.lineno, :content => content } if tag[:label] == "RADAR" then url = "rdar://" + $2 results[:match] = html_escape($1) + "" + html_escape(url) + "" + html_escape($3) else results[:match] = html_escape($1) end tag[:matches] << results end end end end tmpl_file = "#{ENV['TM_BUNDLE_SUPPORT']}/template.rhtml" puts ERB.new(File.open(tmpl_file), 0, '<>').result
